concept.title: Bluetooth Collection Overview
concept.shortdesc: The Bluetooth collection contains the SDP, GAVDP and notifier support components.

section.title: Purpose
section.p: The Bluetooth Collection contains the SDP, GAVDP and notifier support components.

section.title: Components
section.p: The Bluetooth collection contains the following components:

li.p: Bluetooth Service Discovery Protocol (SDP) enables a device to find out what services are available on another device. For example, when connecting a mobile phone to a bluetooth headset, SDP can find out which Bluetooth profiles the headset supports. The SDP component enables devices to register services to the SDP database and to query the database for available services. The SDP Agent and the SDP Database provide functionality for the SDP component.
Generic Audio Video Distribution Profile (GAVDP) enables audio or video streaming.

The Bluetooth Notifiers Support component enables you to create dialogs for interacting with device users about Bluetooth interactions. You can offer Bluetooth dialogs for several purposes, but the main purpose is to provide security for Bluetooth interactions.

section.title: Using the Bluetooth collection
section.p: The Bluetooth collection has the following uses:

li.p: using SDP to find out what services are available on another device
Using GAVDP to enable audio or video streaming
using the Bluetooth Notifiers Support to create dialogs for interacting with device users about Bluetooth interactions.
